alert.note: Alert for Southampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 4:29PM EDT until May 06 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR NORTHAMPTON...NORTHWESTERN HERTFORD AND SOUTH CENTRAL SOUTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 428 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Rich Square, moving northeast at 30 mph. An additional severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles north of Scotland Neck, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. One inch hail was reported by a trained spotter just west of Rich Square. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Conway around 445 PM EDT. Chowan University around 450 PM EDT. Murfreesboro around 455 PM EDT. Boykins and Como around 505 PM EDT. Newsoms around 515 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Eagletown, Milwaukee, Pendleton, Potecasi, Lasker, Jackson, Bryantown, Boones Crossroads, Sunbeam and George. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
